title: Greek Prime Minister Offers New Bailout Concessions
teaser: European officials are ruling out any deal before Sunday's referendum on the bailout, called by Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras.
contentencoded:
Alexis Tsipras sent a letter to Greece’s creditors offering new concessions, but Germany’s chancellor and the finance minister say no one should expect anything to happen with Greece’s bailout deal before the country holds its referendum Sunday.

Eurozone finance ministers are discussing Greece’s latest proposals in a teleconference today. John Psaropoulos has been covering this and joins Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson from Athens with the latest.

Guest

  • John Psaropoulos, independent journalist in Athens, Greece. His blog is “The New Athenian.” He tweets @thenewathenian.
